metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1303 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
A specially crafted HTTP request header could have crashed the Apache HTTP Server prior to version 2.4.30 due to an out of bound read while preparing data to be cached in shared memory. It could be used as a Denial of Service attack against users of mod_cache_socache. The vulnerability is considered as low risk since mod_cache_socache is not widely used, mod_cache_disk is not concerned by this vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1303` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.8').
